notes.text:
An update for ansible is now available for Ansible Engine 2.7

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Ansible is a simple model-driven configuration management,
multi-node deployment, and remote-task execution system. Ansible works over
SSH and does not require any software or daemons to be installed on remote
nodes. Extension modules can be written in any language and are transferred
to managed machines automatically.

The following packages have been upgraded to a newer upstream version: ansible (2.7.16)

Bug Fix(es):
* CVE-2019-14904 Ansible: vulnerability in solaris_zone module via crafted solaris zone
* CVE-2019-14905 Ansible: malicious code could craft filename in nxos_file_copy module

See: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/v2.7.16/changelogs/CHANGELOG-v2.7.rst for details on bug fixes in this release.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Ansible security and bug fix update (2.7.16)

full_product_name.name: ansible-0:2.7.16-1.el7ae.noarch as a component of Red Hat Ansible Engine 2.7 for RHEL 7 Server
ansible-0:2.7.16-1.el7ae.src as a component of Red Hat Ansible Engine 2.7 for RHEL 7 Server

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

notes.text: A flaw was found in the solaris_zone module from the Ansible Community modules. When setting the name for the zone on the Solaris host, the zone name is checked by listing the process with the 'ps' bare command on the remote machine. An attacker could take advantage of this flaw by crafting the name of the zone and executing arbitrary commands in the remote host.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2019-14904 Ansible: vulnerability in solaris_zone module via crafted solaris zone
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Because a flaw exploit would depend on the use of Solaris and Red Hat does not support RHOSP on Solaris, the RHOSP Ansible package will not be updated at this time.

Ansible Engine 2.7.15, 2.8.7, and 2.9.2 as well as previous versions are affected.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes
described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Currently, there is no mitigation for this issue.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-14904 Ansible: vulnerability in solaris_zone module via crafted solaris zone

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: External Control of File Name or Path

notes.text: A vulnerability in Ansible's nxos_file_copy module can be used to copy files to a flash or bootflash on NXOS devices. Malicious code could craft the filename parameter to perform OS command injections. This could result in a loss of confidentiality of the system among other issues.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2019-14905 Ansible: malicious code could craft filename in nxos_file_copy module
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Ansible Engine 2.7.15, 2.8.7, and 2.9.2 as well as previous versions are affected.

Red Hat Gluster Storage 3 and Red Hat Ceph Storage 3 no longer maintain their own version of Ansible. Therefore this fix will be consumed directly from core Ansible.

In Red Hat OpenStack Platform, because the flaw has a lower impact and the fix would require a substantial amount of development, no update will be provided at this time for the RHOSP ansible package.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes
described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
There is no mitigation for this issue, the flaw can only be resolved by applying updates.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2019-14905 Ansible: malicious code could craft filename in nxos_file_copy module
